cntOnlineRes.orName: Biodiversity and Environmental Resource Data System for Belize

dataIdInfo.idPurp: The Belize Basemap is the foundation for most other country specific products. As such this basemap was prepared to facilitate standardized gis-output at Belize country/district level.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: The Belize Basemap is the foundation for most other country specific products. Previous basemaps had problems varying from wrongly positioned cayes and coarse district boundarides. This Basemap attempts to alleviate the most ovbvious shortcomings found in its predecessors.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: The base for this product is an old (1992?) ArcInfo file called "districts" (no metadata), which was produced by (the University of Edinburgh???). This map was updated using geo-referenced Landsat tm images (15 m resolution). This was particularly required in the Marine sector. The correct positioning of the Turneffe Atoll, was facilitated by a large number of ground control points collected by the author

Consts.useLimit: These metadata are not to be removed from the dataset. In case of modifications, credit the original file and author. The map is designed to be used at a level of 1:50,000 at its finest resolution. The boundaries on this map are not sanctioned by the Belize Government, and are no legal description. The user accepts any error(s) in this dataset, and are to report any such errors to the author together with the proposed corrections.

themeKeys.keyword: Belize, Boundaries, Districts, Cayes, Islands, Coastline

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique Identification Number for districts used in the Biodiversity and Environmental Resource Data System for Belize
attr.attrdefs: Biodiversity and Environmental Resource Data System for Belize http://www.biodiversity.bz

dataLineage.statement: The base for this product is an old (1992?) ArcInfo file called "districts" (no metadata), which was produced by (the University of Edinburgh???). This map was updated using geo-referenced Landsat tm images (15 m resolution). This was particularly required in the Marine sector. The correct positioning of the Turneffe Atoll, was facilitated by a large number of ground control points collected by the originator. Quality control was established using two files produced by Emil Cherrington at Cathalac: "bz-cayes-swbd.shp" and "bz-borders-swbd.shp". The origin in these swbd datasets lie in the recognition that relatively large offsets were detected between islands identified on various map products and and those islands’ locations in orthorectified satellite imagery, those boundaries had to be adjusted using the 30m-derived boundaries for offshore cayes extracted from the SRTM Water Body Dataset (SWBD) obtained from the elevation data collected during STRM, the Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (Jarvis et al 2008). Subsequently, distric boundaries were adjusted using a river dataset prepared by Peter Esselman (based on the 1:50,000 DOS topomaps), following rivers and watershed boundaries, where applicable for district boundaries

dataSource.srcDesc: - old (1992?) ArcInfo file called "districts" (no metadata), which was produced by (the University of Edinburgh???). - geo-referenced Landsat tm images (15 m resolution). - large number of ground control points collected by the originator. - two files produced by Emil Cherrington at Cathalac: "bz-cayes-swbd.shp" and "bz-borders-swbd.shp". - river dataset prepared by Peter Esselman (based on the 1:50,000 DOS topomaps)

prcStep.stepDesc: The base for this product is an old (1992?) ArcInfo file called "districts" (no metadata), which was produced by (the University of Edinburgh???). This map was updated using geo-referenced Landsat tm images (15 m resolution). This was particularly required in the Marine sector. The correct positioning of the Turneffe Atoll, was facilitated by a large number of ground control points collected by the originator. Quality control was established using two files produced by Emil Cherrington at Cathalac: "bz-cayes-swbd.shp" and "bz-borders-swbd.shp". The origin in these swbd datasets lie in the recognition that relatively large offsets were detected between islands identified on various map products and and those islands’ locations in orthorectified satellite imagery, those boundaries had to be adjusted using the 30m-derived boundaries for offshore cayes extracted from the SRTM Water Body Dataset (SWBD) obtained from the elevation data collected during STRM, the Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (Jarvis et al 2008). Subsequently, distric boundaries were adjusted using a river dataset prepared by Peter Esselman (based on the 1:50,000 DOS topomaps), following rivers and watershed boundaries, where applicable for district boundaries
prcStep.stepRat: Previous basemaps had problems varying from wrongly positioned cayes and coarse district boundarides. This Basemap attempts to alleviate the most ovbvious shortcomings found in its predecessors.
